fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20739].
  {panel}

Confluence seems to assume that if you're using an HSQL database, it *must* be a file based database located at CONFLUENCE_HOME/database/confluencedb.  So, if you're using a JNDI supplied HSQL database, or using an in memory database (eg {{jdbc:hsqldb:mem:confluence}}), or using HSQL as a server (eg {{jdbc:hsqldb:hsql://localhost/confluence}}, very useful if you actually want to connect to the database externally and browse it while Confluence is still running), or simply pointing it at some other file location, then Confluence fails to startup with the following error:

{noformat}
2010-09-03 13:39:06,978 ERROR [main] [atlassian.confluence.setup.ConfluenceConfigurationListener] contextInitialized An error was encountered while bootstrapping Confluence (see below): 
java.io.FileNotFoundException: /home/jroper/src/atlassian/studio/branches/initialdata/studio-fireball/target/home/confluence-home/database/confluencedb.properties (No such file or directory)
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.io.FileNotFoundException: /home/jroper/src/atlassian/studio/branches/initialdata/studio-fireball/target/home/confluence-home/database/confluencedb.properties (No such file or directory)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.DefaultBootstrapManager.upgradeHSQL(DefaultBootstrapManager.java:226)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.DefaultBootstrapManager.performPersistenceUpgrade(DefaultBootstrapManager.java:176)
	at com.atlassian.config.bootstrap.DefaultAtlassianBootstrapManager.init(DefaultAtlassianBootstrapManager.java:76)
	at com.atlassian.config.util.BootstrapUtils.init(BootstrapUtils.java:35)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.ConfluenceConfigurationListener.initialiseBootstrapContext(ConfluenceConfigurationListener.java:76)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.ConfluenceConfigurationListener.contextInitialized(ConfluenceConfigurationListener.java:40)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.listenerStart(StandardContext.java:3934)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.start(StandardContext.java:4429)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.start(ContainerBase.java:1045)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHost.start(StandardHost.java:722)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.start(ContainerBase.java:1045)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardEngine.start(StandardEngine.java:443)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardService.start(StandardService.java:516)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardServer.start(StandardServer.java:710)
	at org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina.start(Catalina.java:583)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)

Caused by: java.io.FileNotFoundException: /home/jroper/src/atlassian/studio/branches/initialdata/studio-fireball/target/home/confluence-home/database/confluencedb.properties (No such file or directory)

fields.description:
Logging that comes from job threads includes the [NDC information|http://logging.apache.org/log4j/1.2/apidocs/org/apache/log4j/NDC.html] from the setup wizard, or whatever other action was the first one executed in Confluence:

{noformat}
2010-09-03 10:38:02,888 ERROR [pool-9-thread-2] [directory.ldap.mapper.GroupContextMapper] mapFromContext Failed to map attribute <memberDNs> from context with DN <cn=o-group-6643,ou=kid-5,ou=child-0,ou=Bulk,ou=Test,dc=dc-one,dc=crowd,dc=sydney,dc=atlassian,dc=com>
 -- referer: http://localhost:8080/setup/setupstandarddb-start.action?database=postgresql | url: /setup/setupstandarddb.action | userName: anonymous | action: setupstandarddb
{noformat}

In this case, the _referer_ and _url_ information are incorrect. The NDC information should not be set on the Quartz worker threads. This seems to be a bug where it is being transferred from the thread which starts Quartz.

First spotted on the Embedded Crowd branch, but will most probably apply to all versions of Confluence since the NDC was introduced.
fields.summary: Logging thread-local diagnostic context not cleared on Quartz threads

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20732].
  {panel}

Steps to replicate:

# Add one user to confluence-administrator group
# Grant confluence-administrator with all permissions
# Exclude the user from confluence-users group
# Import the space backup attached on this issue

*Notice that the space has explicit permissions set to _confluence-users_ group, no permissions set to _confluence-administrators_ though*

# Make sure the user can see the blogs directly accessing it
# Try to access the page with the macros (_Test Labels_ page)
*The result is on the screen shot*

It seems that these macros are not considering Global permissions set to _confluence-administrators_ group, and as it hasn't permissions on the Space, it's not showing the list of pages and blogs. Although, the user can view such content if directly access it.

*WORKAROUND:* Set 'View' permissions to _confluence-administrators_ group on the Space or add the admin users to confluence-users group
fields.summary: contentbylabel and blog-posts doesn't consider global permission

fields.description:
Hi,

So I have Office 2010 x64 running on Windows 7 x64. I was able to get Confluence working by moving it to an HTTPS URL. Yay!

There is a bug, however. If you edit a document, it first opens in 'Protected mode' in office. You can click 'Enable editing', and edit the document. But when you click save, it says that there was an error transmitting it to the server. It's actually transmitted successfully to Confluence -- for some reason it just says there's an error.

I found a workaround though -- if you disable Protected mode in the Office Trust Center, then it works flawlessly.
fields.summary: Office 2010 Protected mode messes with editing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20722].
  {panel}

h4. {+}The root cause that NPE occurs.{+}
In letter case conversion of the attached file name including the full-width alphabet character, the performed results of both Java "java.lang.String#toLowerCase()" method and PostgreSQL "lower()" function are *NOT* same.

h5. 1. If the input is half-width upper alphabet character (A~Z)
|| || Java\\java.lang.String#toLowerCase() || PostgreSQL lower()\\LANG=ja_JP.UTF-8 || PostgreSQL lower()\\LANG=C ||
|| output | half-width lower alphabet char (/) | half-width lower alphabet char (/) | half-width lower alphabet char (/) ||

h5. 2. If the input is full-width upper alphabet character (Ａ~Ｚ)
|| || Java\\java.lang.String#toLowerCase() || PostgreSQL lower()\\LANG=ja_JP.UTF-8 || PostgreSQL lower()\\LANG=C ||
|| output | full-width lower alphabet char (/) | full-width lower alphabet char (/) | full-width upper alphabet char (x) ||
\\
We guess that this looks like PostgreSQL-specific problem fundamentally.
In PostgreSQL, initializing database with "C" locale setting (--no-locale) is strongly recommended. Please refer the following description for more detail:
{quote}
The drawback of using locales other than C or POSIX in PostgreSQL is its performance impact. It slows character handling and prevents ordinary indexes from being used by LIKE. For this reason use locales only if you actually need them.
http://www.postgresql.org/docs/8.4/interactive/locale.html
{quote}

h4. {+}The solutions for this problem (Proposal).{+}

# *(Recommended)* It is the most desirable to fix the Confluence application.\\So we really want to know the method.
# Initializes database with "japanese" locale and unifies the locale settings of both Java VM and PostgreSQL.\\But as previously described, it cannot recommend to use PostgreSQL with the locale setting except "C" basically.
# Fixes the source code of the lower function of PostgreSQL.\\However, even if this problem has been resolved by the fix, the possibility to widen impact to the outskirts (e.g. other applications connecting to PostgreSQL) is extremely high. So we would like to absolutely avoid the only way to fix PostgreSQL source code directly.

h4. {+}The impact on Japanese customers and marketing.{+}

Most Japanese customers routinely use both full-width alphabet and digit characters to the filename.
It is the very fatal function restrictions for Japanese customers, unless they can use full-width alphabet character to the name of the attached file, and it influences Confluence sales activities in Japan greatly.

h4. {+}A step-by-step of how to reproduce this.{+}
# Download the file (ABC.txt, filename alphabets except an extension are all full-width characters) that I attached here.
# Log in Confluence that you installed on the testing environment.
# Attach the downloaded ABC.txt file in Confluence page.

(i) We installed the above environment *with English language default settings*.
fields.summary: NPE - when attaching a file that the filename contains full-width alphabet character using PostgreSQL

fields.description:
We run Confluence Wiki 3.2.1_01 on Oracle 11.2, and I have a database 'servererror' trigger set which writes to a custom table any ORA- errors that occurs in the database.  This is a practice I do across all the databases I support.

I regularly see multiple occurrences of the following error every day:
ORA-1453 - SET TRANSACTION must be first statement of transaction.   

Our Wiki works fine, and I can not see any errors in the log files about this, so this is probably a blip on your issues radar, but thought I would bring this to your attention anyway, in case you want to investigate it further.  

FYI,... I recently upgraded the database from 10.2.  I also had this same ORA-1453 error occurring there as well.  I also had this on an earlier version of Wiki, but can't remember which version (sorry).

This error has been occurring for as long as I have had the servererror trigger on (about 10 months).

I've included an attachment which provides the custom table and trigger code, along with the occurrences of this error so you can reproduce it and identify in your code where this is. 

Regards

Stuart Uren
Oracle Database Administrator
Clinical Trials Research Unit
University of Auckland
Auckland, New Zealand
fields.summary: ORA-1453 error occurs somewhere in background of Wiki

fields.description:
When hovering on a user link, only the drop shadow of the hover menu appears.

How to reproduce: Visit http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/recentlyupdated.action?key=DOC and hover over a username in the recently updated menu.

Reason: The hovering script can't find the username and therefore tries to look up the user "undefined". This happens as the username is supplied as a CSS class in the link and not in the "data-username" attribute as expected by the hovering script. A fixed version of the UserLink class is attached.
fields.summary: User link hovering does not work in the recent changes macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20714].
  {panel}

From Charles Hall:
{quote}
We've recently upgraded from Confluence 2.8 to 3.2. The left navigation theme was a popular choice for many wiki spaces, but now most users seem to be transitioning well to the new documentation theme.

We did have one comment though from a user expressing some disappointment that the space search built into the left sidebar of the documentation theme was not a "live" search. Through the use of the "Navigation" page, many users had added both live search and pagetree, so I can sympathise that they felt there was a small loss of functionality with the new documentation theme.

However, we took a look at the velocity template for the documentation theme (doctheme-page.vmd) and have made a small mod so that live search is now offered in place of the regular search. Here's the mod:

Before (lines 6 to 10):

{noformat}
            #if (!$params.get("mode").contains("edit"))
            <content tag="tree">
            $helper.renderConfluenceMacro("{pagetree:root=@home|searchBox=true}")
            </content>
            #end

            After:

            #if (!$params.get("mode").contains("edit"))
            <content tag="tree">
            ## CHCH 26/08/10 - Replaced Pagetree search with Live Search
            $helper.renderConfluenceMacro("{livesearch:spaceKey=$spaceKey}")
            $helper.renderConfluenceMacro("{pagetree:root=@home|searchBox=false}")
            </content>
            #end
{noformat}
{quote}
fields.summary: Add Live Search to the Documentation Theme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20711].
  {panel}

Based on discussion over at the manual:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Viewing+an+Older+Version+of+a+Page?focusedCommentId=223221050#comment-223221050

I've come here to file the bug as suggested.  Specifically, for archival/audit purposes, we want to be able to link to older versions of a page.  This is currently possible, but only at the cost of using an opaque identifier.  This means, to verify that a link points to the right page, you actually have to follow the link, and see the name of the page.

I have two uses for this:
On the current version of a page, I want to link to an older version of the same page - for example to indicate the version of a page that was "approved".

On some other page, I want to be able to gather up links to a collection of pages related to some particular subject, and capture the state of those documents at a particular point in time.

Both of these can be done now, but at the cost of click-through to verify the correct link.  This makes tracking links to older versions of pages far more error prone.  For example, I might easily link to the wrong version of a page, or I might put add a typo, an invalid opaque ID, and not link to anything at all, thus losing the original intent.
fields.summary: Useful URL to older versions of pages

fields.description:
The comment is "MS Word on Windows doesn't realise the encoding is UTF-8 unless this meta tag is present".

This is due to your HTML comment in a Velocity template.

However, it's weird to treat an HTML comment as a "Confluence comment". I develop a Confluence plugin where I did the same - I put the HTML comment and it appeared in DOC file. This should never happen, HTML comment is a thing that should be ignored - I have never seen a page that renders <!-- comments --> :)

fields.description:
"pageId" is a magical query parameter that is parsed by Confluence whenever it appears in the url that points to webwork action. Nothing happens when pageId has a value of existing page id or unexisting. But if the pageId is an ID of the draft, exception is thrown.

To reproduce:
1. Create a draft. Check its ID.
2. Go to http://confluence.atlassian.com/users/viewmyprofile.action?pageId=DRAFT_ID or even custom xwork action that is defined in atlassian-plugin.xml

Looking into the Confluence code:
{noformat}
    public String getSpaceFromPageId(long pageId)
    {
        AbstractPage page = (AbstractPage) pageManager.getById(pageId);
        if (page != null) // page exists.
        {
            return page.getSpaceKey();
        }
        return null;
    }
{noformat}

Probably you wanted there if (page instanceof AbstractPage) { do your stuff } else { return null; }

fields.summary: pageId query parameter can't be used in own web actions because of ClassCastException
HTML user macros with script blocks don't work in documentation theme left panel

fields.description:
To reproduce:

# Switch to Documentation Theme
# Configure the theme to add {spaces} macro in the Navigation panel (Header and Footer have same behaviour)
# Save, then view any page in the Space

The same issue applies with any macro that produces JavaScript.

*Workaround for User Macros*

To work around this problem in a user macro, you can include the left angle bracket (<) which starts the script tag twice:

{code:html}
<<script type="text/javascript">...</script>
{code}

If you need to use the macro in page content as well as in the sidebar, create a separate macro for the sidebar with this double-left-angle-bracket workaround.

The following issues are fixed by this release:

fields.description:
When using the 3.3.1's default theme on the Edit page, multiple browses receive a 404 when switching to the Rich Text or Preview tabs. Firebug shows a 404 occuring from the following URLs:
	/pages/undefined/plugins/macrobrowser/browse-macros.action
	/pages/undefined/pages/rendercontent.action
	/pages/undefined/json/convertwikimarkuptoxhtmlwithoutpagewithspacekey.action

This appears to be the opposite of CONF-18437; per that issue, we have verified that main.vmd includes the line:
#parse ("/template/includes/global-settings.vm")

Not sure if this is related, but our instance is several years old, and has been upgraded multiple times:
2.6.?
2.10.1
3.0.1
3.2.1
3.3
3.3.1

* Downloaded Confluence one-click evaluation installer (EXE)
* Run the installation program (using the 'run as administrator' option)
* Installation succeeded
* Open up browser - got the confluence setup wizard
* Created an evaluation license on my.atlassian.com
* Pasted the evaluation license into the license box and hit 'Evaluation Installation'
* Got system error

{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.VersionSpecificDocumentationBean.getVersionSpecificNumber(VersionSpecificDocumentationBean.java:29)

fields.summary: Confluence Evaluation on windows barfs out when going through the installation procedure

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce
# Create pageA and attach some files
#* Insert \{attachments\} macro
!^pageA.jpg!
# Create pageB
#* Insert \{include:pageA\}
!^pageB.jpg!
# View pageB
#* Clicking on *Properties* will result System Error page with the following stack trace:
{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.MoveAttachmentAction.bootstrap(MoveAttachmentAction.java:115)

Stack Trace:[hide]

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.MoveAttachmentAction.bootstrap(MoveAttachmentAction.java:115)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.webwork.BootstrapAwareInterceptor.intercept(BootstrapAwareInterceptor.java:18)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.interceptor.AroundInterceptor.intercept(AroundInterceptor.java:35)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:165)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.user.actions.UserAwareInterceptor.intercept(UserAwareInterceptor.java:58)
{noformat}
#* Clicking on *Remove* does not take effect
#* Clicking on *View* (for Office files) will result Page Not Found
!^pagenotfound.jpg!

h5. Findings
Possible cause: the link of attachments in pageB is referring to {{pageid}} of pageB instead of its source {{pageid}} (pageA)
|| Functions || Link in pageA || Link in pageB || Remarks ||
|| File link | http://localhost/download/attachments/7602191/Document1.doc | http://localhost/download/attachments/7602191/Document1.doc | (/) |
|| Properties | http://localhost/pages/editattachment.action?pageId=7602191&fileName=Document1.doc | http://localhost/pages/editattachment.action?pageId=7602193&fileName=Document1.doc | (x) - System Error page with NPE|
|| Remove | http://localhost/pages/removeattachment.action?pageId=7602191&fileName=Document1.doc&version=1 | http://localhost/pages/removeattachment.action?pageId=7602193&fileName=Document1.doc&version=1 | (x) |
|| Edit in Office | http://localhost/plugins/servlet/confluence/default/Global/ds/pageA/Document1.doc | http://localhost/plugins/servlet/confluence/default/Global/ds/pageA/Document1.doc | (/) |
|| View | http://localhost/pages/worddav/preview.action?fileName=Document1.doc&pageId=7602191 | http://localhost/pages/worddav/preview.action?fileName=Document1.doc&pageId=7602193 | (x) - Page Not Found |

h5. Workaround
Just found out that if you click on *Remove* once in pageB, all functions of attachments macro will work fine as the {{pageid}} is now referring to the correct source (pageA).
(!) However, be careful in clicking on *Remove* link twice as it will remove the attachment
fields.summary: Some functions of {attachment} macro does not work when the page is included in another page using {include} macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20678].
  {panel}

If the users are stored in the DB, Confluence just blocks additional ones. However, if it is connected with an external repository, and the "Can Use" groups already have more members than allowed, Confluence will restrict access and editing permissions to it's content.

What needs to be done: 

1. Inform the Admin about the situation (an email would be OK).
2. Provide to the Admin 1 or 2 days to fix the problem.
fields.summary: When using external user repositories, if the license limit is going to be reached, send an email to the Admin and give him a time to fix it

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed a cross-site request forgery (XSRF) vulnerability which may affect Confluence instances in a public environment. The XSRF vulnerability is exposed in the Confluence Mail Page plugin. Note that the Mail Page plugin is disabled by default. If you do not have this plugin enabled, your site will not be affected.

An attacker might take advantage of the vulnerability to trick users into unintentionally submitting malicious data. An XSRF attack works by exploiting the trust that a site has for the user. If a user is logged into Confluence and an attacker tricks their browser into making a request to a Confluence URL, then the task is performed as the logged in user.

You can read more about XSRF attacks at cgisecurity and other places on the web:
http://www.cgisecurity.com/csrf-faq.html

Please refer to the security advisory for details of the vulnerability, risk assessment and mitigation strategies:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/7ARODQ
fields.summary: XSRF vulnerability in the Mail Page plugin

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability which may affect Confluence instances in a public environment. The XSS vulnerability is exposed in the document import function of the Confluence Office Connector.
* An attacker might take advantage of the vulnerability to steal other users' session cookies or other credentials, by sending the credentials back to such an attacker's own web server.
* XSS vulnerabilities potentially allow an attacker to embed their own JavaScript into a Confluence page. An attacker's text and script might be displayed to other people viewing the page. This is potentially damaging to your company's reputation.

You can read more about XSS attacks at cgisecurity, CERT and other places on the web:
* http://www.cgisecurity.com/articles/xss-faq.shtml
* http://www.cert.org/advisories/CA-2000-02.html

Please refer to the security advisory for details of the vulnerability, risk assessment and mitigation strategies:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/7ARODQ
fields.summary: XSS vulnerability in the Office Connector

fields.description:
Earlier versions of Confluence allow the administrator to set the temporary storage location for the View File macro, part of the Office Connector. Provided an attacker has gained administrative access to the system in some way, they could then exploit this vulnerability to save malicious files onto the file system.

Please refer to the security advisory for details of the vulnerability, risk assessment and mitigation strategies:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/7ARODQ
fields.summary: Confluence should not allow configuration of Office Connector temporary storage location

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed a path traversal vulnerability in various Confluence actions. By exploiting a path traversal vulnerability, attackers can retrieve any file on the server that is running Confluence, based on the permissions of the user under which Confluence is running. Path traversal attacks are also called 'directory traversal' or dot-dot-slash (../) attacks.

You can read more about path traversal attacks at Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP) and other places on the web:
http://www.owasp.org/index.php/Path_Traversal

Please refer to the security advisory for details of the vulnerability, risk assessment and mitigation strategies:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/7ARODQ
fields.summary: Path traversal vulnerability in various Confluence actions
Styles for Nav-map macro are stripped out when displayed within the Documentation and Left Nav theme

fields.description:
To reproduce:

1. add hyper link in MS word 
2. Use full tiny link (with context path) ex: https://yoursite.com/your_context/x/QQQQ
3. Give different link text
4. Paste link from word into RTE
5. Go to wiki markup tab
6. Note url has lost the "your_context" part, which breaks the link.

It is clearly something related to JavaScript, but the behavior of the bug is different for each browser. While IE is able to render a well formed URL, missing the context path, Chrome and Firefox break the URL, leaving just the last piece of it, something like "../x/QQQQ", without "http://yoursite.com/your_context"
fields.summary: Tiny Link copy and pasted from MS Word loses context path in RTE

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce
# Start any Confluence versions from 3.1 - 3.2.1
# Open a Confluence page
# Minimize the browser window (Please use IE 7 or 8 for this test)
# Edit the page in Rich Text mode. Make sure the cursor is at the top of the page
# Click on macro browser icon
# Browser won't be able to view the search box for macro browser
#* [Screenshot|^macrobrowser.png]
# Maximize the browser window. Browser still won't be able to find the search box.
#* [Screenshot|^macrobrowser2.png]

h5. Findings
# This bug does not take place in Wiki Markup mode
# Could not replicate the problem in Confluence 3.3 onwards
# Does not happen in Firefox
fields.summary: Macro Browser could not display search field when browser is minimized (and even after maximized later) in IE

fields.description:
When attempting to alter the page restrictions on a page on EAC one of two things happen:

1. On the "Edit" page, the restrictions link does not appear
1a. Using Tools->Restrictions; you are presented with the Restrictions page, but there is no way to add restrictions

2. On some pages the "Restrictions" link appears on the "Edit" page, but the changes are not saved.
fields.summary: Edit Page Restrictions doesn't work on EAC
Unable to prevent editing of comments in administration GUI

fields.description: Umbrella issue for any bugs associated with whitespaces in usernames
fields.summary: Whitespace in usernames umbrella issue

fields.description: We have had a couple of occurrences of tables getting locked and causing significant blocking. Our DBA opened a case with Oracle and they found that the problematic sql was "delete from CONTENT where CONTENTID=:1". They determined that there needed to be an index added to confancestors.ancestorid column or we will see this type of behavior. I found a comment in the Atlassian documentation about this exact issue and posted a reply there as well. http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Data+Model.
fields.summary: Table locking when deleting from content

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce
# Go to Dashboard > <space-name> > Browse Space using IE7
# Hover on to the Browse menu
# You might need to resize your browser in order to reproduce the issue
# The drop down menu will be positioned behind the tabs as shown in the following screenshot:
!dropdown.png!

h5. Findings
* This issue only happens in IE7 and IE8(compatibility mode)
* This issue only happens in versions 2.10.4 and below
fields.summary: Menu dropdowns appearing behind tabs in IE7
Constraint violations for packages error logs

fields.description:
Create a page in Confluence with a page gadget
Export the space
delete the space
import the space

The page gadget will show an error:
The resource https://qa-eac.atlassian.com/rest/gadget/1.0/pagegadget/getrenderedpage.json?pageId=1851853185, cannot be found.
fields.summary: Page gadgets do not survive a space export and import.

fields.description:
Open IE7
Open this link on qa-eac:
https://qa-eac.atlassian.com/display/~mhrynczak/Checklist+-+Widget+Connector

Look at the Vimeo link.  There is a blank screen.  

This renders with no problem in Firefox.
fields.summary: Widget connector does not show Vimeo link in IE7

fields.description:
Open this page in qa-eac:
https://qa-eac.atlassian.com/display/~mhrynczak/Checklist+-+Widget+Connector

Look at the Episodic widget.  It shows a blank screen with an empty scrollbar.

The link appears in Firefox but not IE7
fields.summary: Widget connector shows blank screen for Episodic in IE7

fields.description:
Preview doesnt show the entire page.  Works fine on Safari and Chrome.

Steps to reproduce.

Create a long Page in either Wiki or Rich Text mode...

Click Preview...
fields.summary: Preview does not show entire page in FF OS X

fields.description:
When installing confluence for the first time, on the content creation page the highlighted tab on the left can be highlighted as the wrong stage or not at all.
See attachments.
fields.summary: Highlighted stage is wrong on product install

fields.description:
# go to dashboard
# mark a space as favourites by clicking on the star
# click the star again to unselect it
# go to the my tab, the space still remains selected
# refresh the dashboard, the space still remains as a favourite

Tried at CAC and can replicate the error.
fields.summary: Spaces cannot be unmarked as favourites

fields.description:
The "Edit in Word" feature currently causes authentication to be run twice. The first is done by Confluence's security filter and properly uses the custom authenticator. The second call wrongly uses the DefaultAuthenticator and not the custom authenticator due CONF-20365.

There are 2 issues here, either of which will fix this and allow it to work again, but both of which should be fixed:
# CONF-20365 The custom authenticator is not respected
# The second authentication is redundant.
fields.summary: Edit in Word does not work when a custom authenticator is configured

fields.description:
Link colours and underlining methods are inconsistent and there is a blue underline underneath the header (ala Fisheye).  These affect both Firefox and IE8 on QA=EAC.

The impact of this bug is that the affordance of links now varies throughout the product - some are underlined, some aren't. This makes it more difficult to immediately see what is and isn't a link. Given how pervasive links are throughout the product, I would classify this as a pretty major usability problem. The colour is less of an issue but would presumably be fixed by the same thing.

(Stephen says, "What the fuck, people???????")
fields.summary: Links are not the right colour and underlining is inconsistent on QA-EAC

fields.description:
Following [this guide|http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=219021702], I started to use the websudo annotations to secure an XWork action that would process a form in the space admin tab.

The plugin is meant to work with Confluence 3.3 and I haven't released a public version of it yet (it's being developed). After the annotations were moved to SAL (in Confluence 3.4-m3?), I am seeing this problem.

* If I replace the websudo annotations from Confluence 3.3 in the plugin with those from SAL, the plugin probably won't work in Confluence 3.3
* If I don't replace the annotations, the plugin won't work in Confluence 3.4.

It would be great if Confluence could provide a backwards compatible way of securing such XWork actions.
fields.summary: websudo annotation backwards compatibility (Confluence 3.3)

fields.description:
The form to edit space details (from within a space, Browse > Space Admin > Edit Space Details under the Space Operations heading) redirects a user to the Advanced tab after they save the form, or decide to cancel editing.

A proposed solution is to:

* Leave the current display version of the space details form in the Advanced tab so that non-admin users can view the details of a space
* Create an additional display version of the space details form that resides in the Space Admin tab, this will be the default location for the Space Admin tab.
** The "Space Details" section will default in display mode with an "Edit" button.
** When a user finishes editing the form and clicks save/cancel, they are shown the display version of the form in the Space Admin tab.
* Rename the current navigation buttons under the Space Operations heading to read 'Space Details' and 'Space Labels' rather than 'Edit Space Details' and 'Edit Space Labels'
** When a user clicks on 'Space Details', they are initially taken to the display version of the space details form, from which they can click a button to start editing.

These changes aim to achieve cross-product and intra-product consistency.
fields.summary: Space details form should have display/viewing mode in the same (space admin) tab

fields.description:
The numbered outline codes don't work when it's copied an Unicode line separator, U+2028.
To reproduce this problem:
# Select a text with this character
# Copy it
# Paste it to WikiMarkup
# Add an numbered outline code in front of this text (\#)
# Switch to Preview page
# Check if the numbered outline is shown

\\To reproduce this behavior you can use the following text.

# Line without special character: xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxx xxx xxx xxx
##  Line with Special character: xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx -    - xxx xxx xxx xxx xxx
#  Line with Special character: xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx -    - xxx xxx xxx xxx xxx

\\If this text is copied and pasted in another text editor (eg. notepad++), you will see the following characters.

##  Line with Special character: xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxx -  ? - xxx xxx xxx xxx xxx

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server and Data Center*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-20593].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

By design, [when copying a single page, its restrictions will not be copied automatically|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/page-restrictions-139414.html#PageRestrictions-Copyarestrictedpage]. Hence, if the page contains information that should be private, user would need to remember to reapply restrictions in the editor _before_ publishing the page, to avoid notifying people who are watching the space (as the copied page will be unrestricted). 
h3. Suggested Solution

To copy page restrictions together automatically when copying a Confluence page. 

(i) There are various complicating factors to consider:
 * What if the user copying the page doesn't have "restrict page" permission? Are the restrictions removed on the new page in that case? Should the user be warned somehow?
 * What if the user copying the page doesn't have permissions to edit the original page? I would expect them to have them included in the restrictions automatically.

h3. Workaround 

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Copying a page should also copy its restrictions

fields.description:
If you do an LDAP integration, if the usernameAttribute is not part of the DN that defines the members of Groups, then Confluence will cause this problem, though it will allow them to use confluence if that group has 'can use' defined, as well as access any spaces that specifically grant view permission to that particular group.

Take for example this scenario, the members attribute does not include employeeNumber in the DN:

In atlassian-user.xml, there is attribute:

{code}
<usernameAttribute>employeeNumber</usernameAttribute>
{code}

An example user:

{noformat}
dn: uid=azwandi,ou=People,dc=atlassian,dc=com
cn: Azwandi Mohd Aris
employeeNumber: 9035
givenname: Azwandi
sn: MohdAris
uid: azwandi
{noformat}

An example group:

{code:none}
dn: cn=super-heroes,ou=Support Practices,ou=Departments,dc=atlassian,dc=com
cn: super-heroes
member: uid=azwandi,ou=People,dc=atlassian,dc=com
{code}

This results in the following:

!ldap_group.png!

Notice the difference when the same LDAP user is added to local group (displays fine):

!local_group.png!
fields.summary: LDAP user details in LDAP group browser are incorrect if there is a mismatch on membership attribute DN and usernameAttribute

fields.description:
We are seeing several users having OutOfMemory errors due to a bug in the JIT compiler when Java 6 update 18 and above (verified up to update 21). This seems to affect both 64 and 32-bit JVMs. We currently have a [KB article about the issue|http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=219023686] too.

There is an [open bug|http://bugs.sun.com/view_bug.do?bug_id=6973402] in -Sun- Oracle's bug tracker about the issue, but I'm not very hopeful of them fixing it any time soon given it's been an issue since update 18 which was released in January and they haven't fixed it in 3 versions.

It would be good if we included the workaround as part of our standalone install. This would involve modifying the Tomcat startup files. It would be nice if we could add the workaround (i.e. to prevent the JIT compiler from compiling the Foreach.render method) only for Java versions that are affected, as there is a slight performance penalty for the workaround.

It might also be worth looking into why that particular method is the problem and whether we can do anything to change it so it isn't (e.g. upgrade velocity?)

We should also make customers more aware of the issue by mentioning it in the release notes. (Make doc team aware of this?)
fields.summary: Work around JIT compiler bug that causes OutOfMemory error

fields.description:
If you have a ! in your link title, it breaks the link (presumably because Confluence interprets the ! as wiki markup). This is particularly problematic for Autocomplete. For example, I use autocomplete to link to a page with a ! in the title.

!http://img.skitch.com/20100813-g27xw2njk1kfc32xba6ks4ses8.jpg!

It looks fine in the RTE:
!http://img.skitch.com/20100813-rian8dibbs2spttby67cjc2cjg.jpg!

But it breaks when I preview it:
!http://img.skitch.com/20100813-npwqaqgpsa2we9me21j5mw65c7.jpg!

Removing the ! from the page title fixes the problem:
!http://img.skitch.com/20100813-mk8h4grkdhqag29yf6mc1jxe7d.jpg!

Presumably a move to XHTML will fix this?
fields.summary: Can't have a ! in a link name

fields.description:
There was similar regression a few months ago, but then IIRC it was fixed.
Now, any comment of non-trivial size cannot be previewed - only the first part (cut at 200 or so pixels) is visible in preview.

That makes commenting highly risky, especially if you later on cannot edit your own comments. And always editing later on your own comments is bad and people generally avoid it.

IMO it's critical as it impacts the adoption of Confluence. People who want to polish their thoughts before posting will hate Confluence with this bug.
fields.summary: My comments in preview mode are cut to first X pixels.
